caption: two days ago was our first time we went to this excellent restaurant. But It is definitely not the last. We enjoyed the evening very much with the good service, with the high quality cooking and wine and with the comfortable cost. We will no doubt go back there soon.
Always come here for special occasions, and always realise why we do. Food, outstanding, service, impeccable.
One of my fav places for french food. Had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. Prices that are reasonable. Atmosphere is similar to a place in Columbus I loved.

French food at this place - excellent. everyone at our table was enjoying everything. had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. the place has a great feel to it. reminds me of a restaurant in philadelphia that i enjoyed.
My fav spot for tasty French food. Great location to meet with friends. Quick and friendly service. Kinda of like a restaurant in Los Angeles I loved to visit.

Oh wow! Another 5-star restaurants on my list. Corn soup is sticky (in a good way) with strong aroma, duck is just phenomenal (order it please), and not to mention foie gras burger—simply enjoyable with many notes. Service is good, price is ok if you skip alcohol, and the portion is good. Look forward to coming back again.
Good scene for tasty French food. visited at eight, it was not full. looking forward to a return trip. the bill was fair.
My top spot for tasty french food. i love this place so much. prices were good for how much you get.
I get to eat here a lot since I work in the area. I got to say their customer service is always good and they keep the spot well kept constantly. Pricing is convenient and they serve big portions.
Had a fantastic experience in here with my kids. The food was served fast and the customer service is just excellent. Prices are convenient.
Delicious food, and amazing staff
Excellent restaurant week menu. Food was prepared well, delicious flavors, subtly distinctive. Only one other restaurant week menu compares - Naha. :)
Would certainly recommend trying this place. Great atmosphere, delightful dishes, excellent customer service. Keep up the good work.

I have not enjoyed most fancy places I've been because they had small portions and were no better than normal places. Brindille had small portions but was actually a grade above most things I've eaten -Robert

Despite the fact that we arrived on time for our reservation, we were asked to wait for half an hour on the bar (while 2 other couples, who arrived after us, were seated).  On top of that, the table we were seated was horrible; our table was between two large loud groups on a very tight space... The food was OK, but overall I have had much better for the price.  I would have given a 1-star, but the service was great, so 2-stars for that.  Not coming back!
The customer service is constantly efficient, good mood, helpful staff. Will visit here again when I get in town.
Is a small place with a simple menu but very well executed. The very intimate ambiance is not restriction to have an excellent party wit your friends and colleagues.
The place serves large dishes and for convenient rates. very friendly staff members. Highly recommended.

I meet friends in this lovely spot from time to time! This is the best place to have a bite.  I visit this place many times. The meals are excellent, the workers are welcoming and the payment is affordable. I enjoy meeting in this place over a rich lunch.
Great place to get food when in a hurry. Their service is quick, prices are reasonable, fantastic character. Highly recommended

The best for gras dish I have ever eaten. There was a group of somewhat over the the reasonable alcohol consumption business men initially but once they left the noise level dropped off. It was friendly  service and absolutely wonderful food.
This place obviously knows how to treat their clients. Always with a nice demeanor. The food is affordably priced, constantly fresh and neat.
Distinctive dining and the food was Fantastic!  Simple decor but delectible entrees.  The quail is perfection with a buttery Chablis and after dinner sweets...

I went to a wonderful private wine tasting this afternoon at Brindille and the food and service was excellent.  The atmosphere was lovely and there was no loud music that allowed for pleasant conversation.  We had several courses and the wines paired nicely with the food.  Bravo to everyone that worked so hard for this tasting event!
I really loved their food. I always get awesome customer service there. The place is well organised and the employees are always super friendly. Would recommend to others.

Chose to give Brindille a shot after a LOT of looking over info on various high-end restaurants in Chicago - we were NOT disappointed.  Heavy traffic delayed us, I called and advised them, they said thanks, and we showed 20 minutes late to a very hearty welcome.  We brought along two bottles of fine wine from my cellar: a dry white 2014 "Y" from the Château d'Yquem, and a 1990 Château d'Yquem which absolutely floored us for its perfection!  "Y" is also called "Ygrec," which is the French name for that letter of the alphabet.  We also bought a bottle of 2013 Albert Boxer Gewurztraminer Reserve from Alsace.  Two of us dined on the following, sharing dishes:  Appetizers, which were generously portioned:  CHESAPEAKE BAY SOFT SHELL CRAB Charred Heirloom Tomato, Red Onion & Provençal Black Olives with soft white corn polenta, roquette leaves and french date vinegar butter. Amazing crab, especially in Chicago, where they're not pulled out of nearby waters.  Also quite liked the polenta, and the overall flavors were well chosen.  Eaten with two wines we brought, preferred with Ygrec.  CRISP BELLY OF BERKSHIRE PORK Cardamom Roasted Pineapple & Pickled Ramps, Beauty Heart Radish and Candied Pecans, Natural Jus with Kishmish "Green" Raisins, Blueberries, and While Balsamic "Crisps." Delicious, juicy, tender, flavorsome bit of pork with a nice then layer of crispy fat.  Everything that was part of it built the whole up to the spectacular appetizer which this was - went best with some of the Yquem.  SEARED HUDSON VALLEY FOIE GRAS - (FROM GOOSE) Blackberry, Amber Afghani Saffron and Strawberry Friponnes, Anise Seed and Tarragon Savory Toast, Green Almondine Tea Gelée, Banyuls, Anise Hissop and Maché. It is hard to mess up Foie Gras if you're competent in your kitchen, and these folks definitely did it justice.  I'd say a trip to Brindille is worth making JUST to eat this!  It was marvelous with the '90 Yquem.  SEA SCALLOPS NAHA SCENTED WITH VANILLA BEAN, Citrus and Spices, Caramelized Belgian Endive "Marmalade," Late Summer Plums, Frangrant Marigold and Bergamot Flowers with a Nage of Carrot, Coriander and Lemongrass Just superb!  Properly caramelized scallops, looking like a perfectly toasted marshmallow, are a special favorite of both of us.  These were nicely succulent both the Ygrec and the Yquem, but in the end, the Yquem was even better.  Entrées, which were also generous and amazing!  Well, we were disappointed to learn that the Sole Meunier on the menu was not available, it had been a major motivator for our choice, but other items on the menu undid our sadness.  BUTTER POACHED MAINE LOBSTER, 'Corn on the Cob,' Striped Beets and Jerusalem Artichoke, Salpicon of Gold Beets and Celery, Celery Root, Crustacean Lobster Broth and Summer Garden Herb Salad. Ooooh, LOBSTER!  Juicy and succulent and perfectly cooked, again, all those things combined with it were just perfection on a plate of flavors.  It went well with both the Ygrec and Yquem, but we both preferred the Yquem.  Lacquered Aged Moulard Duck Breast with a Pavé Tarte of "Red Haven" Peaches, Roasted Fennel, and Tropea Onions, Medjool Date, Braised Leeks, Bronze Fennel, and Apple Mint. As with the lobster, another perfection of (different) flavors on a plate.  many people would want to drink red wine with duck, but those in the know are aware that a good Sauternes can pair amazingly with it, and for us, the Yquem took this tasty duck to an even higher level.  FORTUNATELY, we'd paced ourselves so as to be able to enjoy the artisanal cheese selection as our final.  It consisted of a dozen French Cheeses.  I've attached a photo of the list, so am abbreviating them here, along with which wine we determined was the best compliment.  For my comments, please see the pic, as I've exceeded my character limit.
One of my favorite places ever with some of my favorite people in the world.
Amazing quality and service
Nice scene for french food. I give this place two thumbs up. Service is typically above par. The place has an awesome feel to it.
Ok spot for delicious french food. the bill was fair for the quality of food.
Amazing French cuisine - would recommend the chef’s tasting experience, our favorite was the duck entree

As a 21 year old it was still very much enjoyable and well worth the money for the experience! My girlfriend and I were at odds over whether the duck or quail was better( I think the quail)! Make reservations and you shouldn't have a problem at all.

Sorry to say I was disappointed with Brindille - we waited an hour for two appetizers and a further hour for two entrees to be served. Given that my $60+ Dover Sole would cook in 4 mins it was an excessive wait. The food was decent when it arrived but by 10.30 we'd lost our appetite. Grateful for our wine to be comp'd nonetheless won't be rushing back.
Very good service. The tasting menu with the paired wine was really good
Treat yourself!

I am prejudiced about Brindille, and anything Carrie or Michael Nahabedian do in the restaurant world.  Carrie's skill as a chef is legendary, certainly well known in this country and recognized by the James Beard Foundation.  Michael's business acumen, and aplomb as a restauranteur, helped put Chicago on the "foodie" map.  Yet, most importantly, their warmth, love for family, good food, and happy times reverberates through every restaurant they open.  Brindille is a classic French restaurant, that just happens to be in Chicago.  We were just in Paris for a week, and Brindille would be comfortable as a Michelin starred dining destination, sitting on a block in the sixth, seventh, eighth, sixteenth, or seventeenth arrondissements. As River North changes, overtaken by the hordes of drunken young people, looking for another beer, margarita and fish taco, Brindille sits on Clark Street as a beacon of fine dining. The patrons of Brindille know what Carrie and Michael offer; great food, elegant surroundings, and a dining refuge. Chicago is lucky to have Brindille.  Go and discover what fine dining is all about.  This is grown up elegance.
We came in for drinks and the bartender was really friendly and made us feel welcome. Very knowledgeable about the drinks, definitely will be coming back.
French food and service at this location is great. Visited on a Wednesday I think. The staff was very kind and attentive. This place has a cool atmosphere.
Unbelievable.

This intimate, sophisticated  and romantic spot is an absolute find. A perfectly creative French bistro in River North with James Beard service and food. A foodie find that is not a scene is my definition of perfection.
Just outstanding.

One of the BEST restaurants I have ever been to! From the incredibly welcoming staff, to the pleasant surprise of having a taster cup of warm mushroom soup immediately brought to our table (it was to die for), to the perfectly complimentary dishes, the amazing wine, and just when we thought we couldn’t eat any more, they couldn’t let us leave without bringing a tiny taster from their award-winning pastry chef before we left (best two bites of dessert I have ever had!). We traveled up to Chicago for the very first time to get a taste of their food scene- this was our first stop and we were completely blown away! Keep up the good work, Brindille!
Horrible reduced "restaurant week" menu, table for 2 and value
Terrific place for French food & wine. Staff were very accommodating and friendly. Noise level was a bit loud for conversation, but we had a wonderful time. Highly recommend.
Wonderful service and food.
Cozy, nice restaurant, but don't go there hungry, small portions, good for people who are in diet 😊
Fantastic service, delicious and most perfect dinner! Will be back again!
Delicious brunch, pretty restaurant, perfect service! Thanks!
My best gastronomic restaurant in Chicago The best service I had ever in a restaurant

Easy to get to, valet parking is available, and all of the food was terrific. Make sure to get the scallop and also the corn fennel soup is to die for. When doing the tasting menu, spend the money and get the bigger one for more experiences, and compare prices of wines unless you just want to do the wine pairing, which I recommend.  Overall great!
Simply amazing food and service
The best.  Chef Carrie Naha never dissapoints.  The Ribeye is second to none and the dessert cheese course is very satisfying.
Wonderful Birthday Experience
Flawless. I go here about once a year for some of the best French food I've ever eaten stateside.
I recommend everything!
Garbage

Very positive review of this place - we hosted an executive event for the company here for many of our top clients. We booked the whole venue. Service was superior. People offering to take our coats as we walked in, offer us a cocktail or drinks, and more.  The food was pretty good overall as well. Kicked off with oysters, went into greens/meats, and ended up delicious desserts. Man the dessert was awesome - macaroons, cookies, and more. Very impressed.  The ambiance of this place is very romantic also. Great date spot.  I'd definitely return here for a date, client dinner, or just to catch up with friends.

Love this place so much.  Great for dates or business dinners.  Service is impeccable and food is divine.  Would recommend this place to anyone for a nicer dinner.   The restaurant is on the smaller side but the art they've picked out is so beautiful.  If you appreciate french food, I think you'll really appreciate this place.  It might even be better than NAHA (strong words i know, haha).
This is an excellent, superb! The menu, wine list, and service are all great. It was so good I went two nights in a row! I strongly recommend it.
Exquisite food and service. This is a gem.
Everything on the menu is excellent.
Food was good, but disappointing for the price. Some of the dishes had odd flavor combinations that fell flat. For that price, I would have expected something more creative and more on point
The decor is lovely. The welcome is warm; the service is attentive and the food is wonderful. We recently took our grandson, Elias, and ordered the 5 course meal. He was impressed.
Excellent place.  Room is beautiful and they have a menu with old french standards done with an interesting twist which makes them different and good
Great wine list, excellent food
ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC. Amazing customer service like no other and food to die for. Get a reservation and wine and dine for hours with your guests.
This restaurant is outstanding. Everything was incredibly flavorful and of the highest quality.
Delicious, but at the high end of my budget.
Delicious food, amazing drinks, and top-notch, attentive service.
Met and spoke with the owner. Very knowledgeable staff. Delicious veal.
Food was really good but portions are small, even if that's what you would usually expect from this type of restaurant. The service was great and the chef made vegetarian entrees specially for us.
Awesome quality of food
Expensive but unbelievably good. I highly recommend the tasting menu.

I was lucky enough to go here for a special event with a multi-course tasting menu (with wine pairings). One of the best meals of my life. Well-crafted, thoughtful dishes; excellent pairings; lovely atmosphere; very friendly staff.

We heard about Brindille through the Chicago's Best New Restaurants article in the May 2014 Chicago Magazine.  It was quiet, dark, and very... grey and unassuming. We ordered the beef tenderloin, hand-cut noodles, frisee and a soup; but  I think my favorite part of the dinner was dessert- L'oeuf a la neige was unforgettable.  It is an experience to relish the complex layers of flavors without distraction.

Very nice French style restaurant, even if owners are'nt... Ideal for romantic dinners. Very quiet place. Everything look elegant. Plates tastes good, presentation is perfect and service is excellent. Even the valet parking bring your car before you have to ask for it... Probably one of the top restaurant in Chicago! Why not 5 stars? Because of its prices and its (French) wine list too limited (and expensive too).

Lovely and expensive French restaurant.  Nice elegant decor.  Perfect for a date or celebration.  Try their New Brunswick Oysters.  I was surprised that being a French restaurant they did not have mussels. Their current online menu is not up to date.

An upscale, fine dining spot that stands above the crowded River North dining scene.  The elegant decor matches the rich, decadent dishes.  The ambiance is subdued as the crowd skews noticeably older, likely thanks to the steep prices and extensive wine list.  Everything we ordered was beautifully presented, rich in flavor, and flawlessly prepared.  Best suited for celebrating a special occasion or enjoying a quiet, intimate night out.  - Visited on: August 3, 2013

Pricey, but you will feel it is money well-spent.  The perfect place to celebrate a special occasion, as no detail is remiss!  The Decor feels like it's straight out of Armani Casa.  The servers are well-spoken, friendly, and spot-on with food and wine recommendations--and strike the perfect balance between attentive and unobtrusive.  (Bonus points for the fact that when I started to feel chilly underneath the vent in our cozy banquette, our Server immediately turned it down to a comfortable level).  Tres magnifique!
